newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila's June 1-25 coconut oil exports 121,950 T.
newsitem.headline: Manila's June 1-25 coconut oil exports 121,950 T.

text.p: Philippine coconut oil exports between June 1 and 25 reached 121,950 tonnes or more than thrice the volume shipped in the same month last year, trade group United Coconut Associations of the Philippines Inc said on Monday.
A total of 40,543 tonnes of coconut oil were exported in June 1996.
"The preliminary export figures this month were bloated by two delayed shipments in May carrying at least 60,000 tonnes of oil," a senior trader at a Philippine oil mill said.
"But if you combine the figures in May and June, the average would only be between 75,000 and 76,000 tonnes," the trader added.
UCAP said preliminary coconut products exports in the first six months of the year jumped to 793,720 tonnes compared with 745,870 tonnes in June 1996.
Besides coconut oil, the Philippines also exports copra, dessicated coconut (dehydrated coconut meat), and oleochemicals.
